{{cpp/title|suspend_never}}
{{cpp/coroutine/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=coroutine|since=c++20|
struct suspend_never;
}}

{{tt|suspend_never}} is an empty class which can be used to indicate that an [[cpp/language/coroutines#co_await|await expression]] never suspends and does not produce a value.

===Member functions===
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc mem fun|await_ready|nolink=true|indicates that an await expression never suspends}}
{{dsc mem fun|await_suspend|nolink=true|no-op}}
{{dsc mem fun|await_resume|nolink=true|no-op}}
{{dsc end}}

{{member|{{small|std::suspend_never::}}await_ready|2=
{{ddcl|
constexpr bool await_ready() const noexcept { return true; }
}}

Always returns {{c|true}}, indicating that an await expression never suspends.
}}

{{member|{{small|std::suspend_never::}}await_suspend|2=
{{ddcl|
constexpr void await_suspend( std::coroutine_handle&lt;&gt; ) const noexcept {}
}}

Does nothing.
}}

{{member|{{small|std::suspend_never::}}await_resume|2=
{{ddcl|
constexpr void await_resume() const noexcept {}
}}

Does nothing. An await expression does not produce a value if {{tt|suspend_never}} is used.
}}
